children.value: The Callout component provides callouts to use it in any mdx file, to begin, first import the component.
. These are input for the Callout component's
prop, to render that type of callout. If no type is specificed the type

<Callout
  type="success"
  body="Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33), trade it with your own risk. Binance Perpetual is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>

<Callout
  type="warning"
  body="Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33), trade it with your own risk. Binance Perpetual is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>

<Callout
  type="danger"
  body="Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33), trade it with your own risk. Binance Perpetual is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>

<Callout
  type="info"
  body="Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33), trade it with your own risk. Binance Perpetual is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>

<Callout
  type="bug"
  body="Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33), trade it with your own risk. Binance Perpetual is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>

<Callout
  type="note"
  body="Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33), trade it with your own risk. Binance Perpetual is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>

<Callout
  type="tip"
  body="Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33), trade it with your own risk. Binance Perpetual is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>
The Callout component also takes a prop
which uses identifiers in the input body string to support bold and highlighting. Similar to regular markdown, You can use tags
to surround text in the body input string to highlight, or you can use tags
to surround text in the body input string to bold.

<Callout type="success" body="#Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33)#, trade it with your own risk. #Binance Perpetual# is different from futures contract, please see differences." />

<Callout
  type="success"
  body="#Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33)#, trade it with your own risk. #Binance Perpetual# is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>

<Callout type="warning" body="`Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33)`, trade it with your own risk. `Binance Perpetual` is different from futures contract, please see differences."/>

<Callout
  type="warning"
  body="`Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33)`, trade it with your own risk. `Binance Perpetual` is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>
The Callout component also supports nested links. Similar to regular markdown, You can use opening tag
to surround the text in the body input string to hyperlink it. When using links it is
prop that takes in an array of link strings, which are associated to your

<Callout type="warning" body="Currently [dydx], [terra], and [loopring] don't work on Binary Installers. It can only be used when running Hummingbot from source or with Docker." link={["/spot-connectors/dydx/","/protocol-connectors/terra","/spot-connectors/loopring/"]}/>

<Callout
  type="warning"
  body="Currently [dydx], [terra], and [loopring] don't work on Binary Installers. It can only be used when running Hummingbot from source or with Docker."
  link={[
    "/spot-connectors/dydx/",
    "/protocol-connectors/terra",
    "/spot-connectors/loopring/",
  ]}
/>

If your inputs for identifier tags are not fully closed, or the number of links used don't match with the number of link tags used, then the component will render a message to tell you which prop to fix.
The Callout component also supports the above functionality in the form of bullet points. When applying bullet points,
prop takes in an array of strings with each string rendering into a bulletpoint. Bullet points support bold, highlight and links (mentioned above) and there is no limit to bulletpoint count.
Similar to using links in the
prop which takes an array of URL strings. To hyperlink the text in the
, The order of hyperlinks created by brackets applied in
corresponds with the order of the URL strings you put into the
prop. Please reference the example below.

<Callout
  type="note"
  bullets={[
    "this is bullet1 and I have a hummingbot miners [link].",
    "#this is bullet2 and I have no link but I'm bold.#",
    "`this is bullet3 and I am highlighted and have a` hummingbot docs [link].",
    "this is bullet4 testing dynamic bullet size",
    "this is bullet5 and I don't do anything"
  ]}
  link={["https://miner.hummingbot.io/", "https://docs.hummingbot.io/"]}
/>

<Callout
  type="note"
  bullets={[
    "this is bullet1 and I have a hummingbot miners [link].",
    "#this is bullet2 and I have no link but I'm bold.#",
    "`this is bullet3 and I am highlighted and have a` hummingbot docs [link].",
    "this is bullet4 testing dynamic bullet size",
    "this is bullet5 and I don't do anything",
  ]}
  link={["https://miner.hummingbot.io/", "https://docs.hummingbot.io/"]}
/>

<Callout
  type="note"
  body="Make sure that you [activate] the Anaconda environment with `conda activate hummingbot` prior to running Hummingbot."
  bullets={[
    "This installation method is currently under testing and [awaiting] feedback from users. Should you run into problems or have found a fix to solve errors along the way, feel free to reach out through our [Discord] support channel.",
    "Added #version-0.36.0-arm_beta#, see release notes of [v0.36.0]",
  ]}
  link={["http://discord.hummingbot.io/", "/release-notes/0.36.0/"]}
/>

<Callout
  type="note"
  body="Make sure that you [activate] the Anaconda environment with `conda activate hummingbot` prior to running Hummingbot."
  bullets={[
    "This installation method is currently under testing and [awaiting] feedback from users. Should you run into problems or have found a fix to solve errors along the way, feel free to reach out through our [Discord] support channel.",
    "Added #version-0.36.0-arm_beta#, see release notes of [v0.36.0]",
  ]}
  link={["http://discord.hummingbot.io/", "/release-notes/0.36.0/"]}
/>

<Callout
  type="warning"
  body="Currently [dydx], [terra], and [loopring] don't work on Binary Installers. It can only be used when running Hummingbot from source or with Docker."
  link={["/protocol-connectors/terra", "/spot-connectors/loopring/"]}
/>

<Callout
  type="warning"
  body="`Binance Perpetual connector is released as beta version(0.33), trade it with your own risk. `Binance Perpetual` is different from futures contract, please see differences."
/>
<Callout type="note" body="#Currently can't nest bold and highlight tags.#" />
